citing_paper_authors: Junyi Jessy, Li | Marine, Carpuat | Ani, Nenkova
raw_text: It stands to reason that long sentences will be harder to process automatically and this reasoning has motivated the first approaches to text simplification (Chandrasekar et al, 1996)
clean_text: It stands to reason that long sentences will be harder to process automatically and this reasoning has motivated the first approaches to text simplification (Chandrasekar et al, 1996).

citing_paper_authors: Susana, Bautista | Raquel, Hervás | Pablo, Gervás | Richard, Power | Sandra, Williams
raw_text: Chandrasekar et al (1996) introduced a two stage process, first transforming from sentence to syntactic tree, then from syntactic tree to new sentence; Siddharthan (2002) instead proposed a three stage process comprising analysis, transformation and generation
clean_text: Chandrasekar et al (1996) introduced a two stage process, first transforming from sentence to syntactic tree, then from syntactic tree to new sentence;.

citing_paper_authors: Zhemin, Zhu | Delphine, Bernhard | Iryna, Gurevych
raw_text: The original motivation for sentence simplification is using it as a preprocessor to facilitate parsing or translation tasks (Chandrasekar et al., 1996)
clean_text: The original motivation for sentence simplification is using it as a preprocessor to facilitate parsing or translation tasks (Chandrasekar et al., 1996).

raw_text: Early attempts to text simplification were based on rule-based methods where rules were designed following linguistic intuitions (Chandrasekar et al, 1996)
clean_text: Early attempts to text simplification were based on rule-based methods where rules were designed following linguistic intuitions (Chandrasekar et al, 1996).

raw_text: Simplification decisions about whether to simplify a text or sentence have been studied fol lowing rule-based paradigms (Chandrasekar et al, 1996) or trainable systems (Petersen and Ostendorf,2007) where a corpus of texts and their simplifications becomes necessary
clean_text: Simplification decisions about whether to simplify a text or sentence have been studied following rule-based paradigms (Chandrasekar et al, 1996) or trainable systems (Petersen and Ostendorf,2007) where a corpus of texts and their simplifications becomes necessary.

citing_paper_authors: Sander, Wubben | Antal, van den Bosch | Emiel, Krahmer
raw_text: Sentence simplification can also serve to preprocess the input of other tasks, such as summarization (KnightandMarcu, 2000), parsing, machine translation (Chandrasekar et al, 1996), semantic role labeling (Vickrey and Koller, 2008) or sentence fusion (Filippova and Strube, 2008) .The goal of simplification is to achieve an improvement in readability, defined as the ease with which a text can be understood
clean_text: Sentence simplification can also serve to preprocess the input of other tasks, such as summarization (Knight and Marcu, 2000), parsing, machine translation (Chandrasekar et al, 1996), semantic role labeling (Vickrey and Koller, 2008) or sentence fusion (Filippova and Strube, 2008).

raw_text: Together with syn tactic analysis and transformations similar to those of Chandrasekar et al (1996), they employed lexical simplification based on looking up synonyms in WordNet and extracting Kucera-Francis frequency from the Oxford Psycholinguistic Database (Quinlan, 1992)
clean_text: Together with syntactic analysis and transformations similar to those of Chandrasekar et al (1996), they employed lexical simplification based on looking up synonyms in WordNet and extracting Kucera-Francis frequency from the Oxford Psycholinguistic Database (Quinlan, 1992).

citing_paper_authors: Houda, Bouamor | Aurélien, Max | Gabriel, Illouz | Anne, Vilnat
raw_text: For example, one may want a text to be shorter (Cohnand Lapata, 2008), tailored to some reader profile (Zhu et al, 2010), compliant with some specific norms (Max, 2004), or more adapted for sub sequent machine processing tasks (Chandrasekar et al., 1996)
clean_text: or more adapted for subsequent machine processing tasks (Chandrasekar et al., 1996).

raw_text: A simplification component could be also used as a preprocessing step to improve the performance of parsers (Chandrasekar et al, 1996), summarizers (Beigman Klebanov et al, 2004) and semantic role labelers (Vickrey and Koller, 2008)

citing_paper_authors: Advaith, Siddharthan | Ani, Nenkova | Kathleen R., McKeown
raw_text: Chandrasekar et al (1996) viewed text simplification as a preprocessing tool to improve the performance of their parser
clean_text: Chandrasekar et al (1996) viewed text simplification as a preprocessing tool to improve the performance of their parser.

raw_text: Text simplification has been associated with techniques that deal not only with helping readers with reading disabilities, but also to help NLP systems (Chandrasekar et al, 1996)
clean_text: Text simplification has been associated with techniques that deal not only with helping readers with reading disabilities, but also to help NLP systems (Chandrasekar et al, 1996).

raw_text: It is useful as a preprocessing step for a variety ofNLP systems such as parsers and machine translation systems (Chandrasekar et al, 1996), sum marisation (Knight and Marcu, 2000), sentence fusion (Filippova and Strube, 2008) and semantic role labelling (Vickrey and Koller, 2008)
